intro: Stenophragma suecicum, commonly known as the Swedish thimbleweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features slender, branching stems that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Stenophragma suecicum is typically found in moist meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade.
